block.p: An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
MUSIC

ACCESS TO ART Summer Chamber Music Festival. Court Madrigal Singers with Jim Maher, soloist. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Maris Stella R. C. Church, 5012 Dune Drive, Avalon. Program of Mozart, Dvorak and Max Bruch. Saturday at 8 p.m. St. Simeon's by the Sea, 26th and Central Ave., N. Wildwood. Tickets: $15; $12 for students and older people. (609) 368-8100.

An opinionated guide to cultural and recreational goings-on around the state this week. Items may be submitted by mail to On the Towns, Sunday New Jersey Section, The New York Times, 229 West 43d Street, New York, N.Y. 10036; by fax to (212) 556-7219, or by e-mail to njtowns@nytimes.com.
MUSIC

ACCESS TO ART Summer Chamber Music Festival. Court Madrigal Singers with Jim Maher, soloist. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Maris Stella R. C. Church, 5012 Dune Drive, Avalon. Program of Mozart, Dvorak and Max Bruch. Saturday at 8 p.m. St. Simeon's by the Sea, 26th and Central Ave., N. Wildwood. Tickets: $15; $12 for students and older people. (609) 368-8100.
BAIRD CENTER Outdoor Concert Series featuring Beatlemania. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Meadowland Park, North Ridgewood Road, South Orange. Free. 5 Mead Street, South Orange. (973) 378-7754.
BICKFORD THEATER The Midiri Brothers with John Colianni. Tomorrow at 8 p.m. Tickets: $12. Morris Museum, 6 Normandy Heights Road, Morristown. (973) 538-0454.
CHALFONTE HOTEL ''Concerts by Candlelight'' with the Serenade Reed Trio. Tuesday at 8:30 p.m. in the Magnolia Room. Tickets: $7, or free with dinner. 301 Howard Street, Cape May. (609) 884-8409.
FAIR LAWN SUMMER MUSIC FESTIVAL Marlene Ver Planck, vocalist, and her trio. Tonight at 8:30 p.m. Free. Memorial Park, Berdan Avenue, Fair Lawn. (201) 796-6746.
KASSCHAU MEMORIAL SHELL Tony Corbiscello Big Band. Tuesday at 8:30 p.m. Free. Veterans Field, Maple Avenue, Ridgewood. (201) 444-1776.
MONMOUTH COUNTY LIBRARY Fred Lehotay and the Ragtimers. Tuesday at 7 p.m. Free. 125 Symmes Drive, Manalapan. (732) 431-7242.

NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER ''Absolut Sounds of the City 2000,'' outdoor music series. Thursday evenings, 5 p.m. to 10 p.m., through Aug. 31. Pransemble, sitar ensemble; Scarlett Blue Band, blues; Candela Soul, Latin rock; and John Brown's Body, reggae. Theater Square. 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.
NEWARK'S NEIGHBORHOOD SUMMER CONCERT SERIES Lonnie Youngblood and Joshua Nelson. Wednesday at noon at J.F.K. Recreation Center, 211 West Kinny Street. Free. (973) 733-6454.
NORTH WILDWOOD SUMMER SERIES Philadelphia Boys Choir. Thursday at 8 p.m. The Avalon String Band. Saturday at 8 p.m. North Wildwood's amphitheater, Ocean and Second Avenues. Free. (609) 889-2241.

OCEAN GROVE SUMMER CONCERT SERIES Through Sept. 9. Roger Sayer, organist. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m and Saturday at noon. Free. The Glenn Miller Orchestra. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $22 (reserved); $17 (general admission). The Great Auditorium, Ocean Grove. (732) 988-0645.

PALISADES INTERSTATE PARK COMMISSION Summer Outdoor Concert Series with the Saddle River Valley Concert Band. Wednesday at 8 p.m. Free. ($4 parking charge.) Alpine Picnic Area, Alpine Pavilion. (201) 768-0379.

PARAMOUNT THEATER ''Alabina'' benefit concert featuring Ishtar and Los Ninos de Sara, presented by the Jewish Community Center of Greater Monmouth County. Tuesday at 9 p.m. Tickets: $50 and $36. Fifth Avenues, Asbury Park. (732) 768-4122 or (732) 531-9100, ext. 121.

PNC BANK ARTS CENTER The B-52's and the Go Go's. Tonight at 7 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $45. Yes and Kansas. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $17.50 to $49.50. Dion and Jay Black and the Americans. Thursday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15 to $55. The Moody Blues. Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $21 to $49.50. Reba McEntire. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $22.50 to $75. Exit 116, off the Garden State Parkway, Holmdel. (201) 507-8900.

PRINCETON UNIVERSITY RICHARDSON AUDITORIUM ''New Jersey Symphony Orchestra Chamber Players Amadeus Festival 2000.'' Today at 3 p.m. and Friday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $15, $25 and $40. The St. Petersburg String Quartet. Thursday at 8 p.m. Free. Alexander Hall, Princeton. (609) 258-5000.

RAMAPO COLLEGE Minolta Summer Music Festival. Thursdays through July. The Happenings. Thursday at 8 p.m. Free admission; parking is $5 a car. Band Shell, Ramapo College, 505 Ramapo Valley Road, Mahwah. (201) 684-7611.

RAMAPO COLLEGE Academy of Music Summer Festival. Through Aug. 6. Kirill Gerstein, pianist, Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Mitchell Stern, violinist, Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20; $15 for older people; $12 for children and students. Berrie Center for the Performing Arts, 505 Ramapo Valley Road, Mahwah. (201) 684-7844.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY - CAMDEN Bice Costa Horszowski, pianist, Wednesday at noon. Mallery Room, Fine Arts Building, Third Street between Cooper Street and the Benjamin Franklin Bridge, Camden. (856) 225-6176.
ST. ELIZABETH'S COLLEGE Masterwork Chorus presents the Requiems of Mozart and Durufle. Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $8. Route 124, Convent Station. (973) 455-7008.

SCHOLA CANTORUM ON HUDSON ''Midsummer Night's Open Swing.'' Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $10; $6 for older people and students. St. Peter and Paul Church, 404 Hudson Street, Hoboken. (201) 858-0756.

SHANGHAI JAZZ Ken Peplowski and Michael Moore. Wednesday at 7 p.m. Junior Mance, jazz pianist. Thursday at 7 p.m., Friday at 6:45 p.m. and 8:30 p.m. and Saturday at 6:30 p.m. and 8:45 p.m. No cover; $15 to $25 minimum. 24 Main Street, Madison. (973) 822-2899.
SIX FLAGS GREAT ADVENTURE Mark Wills. Saturday at 8 p.m. Free with park admission. Northern Star Arena, exit 7A off the New Jersey Turnpike. (732) 928-2000.
SOMERSET COUNTY PARK COMMISSION Verdict, reggae, calypso, soca and funk. Tonight at 7 p.m. Free. Duke Island Park bandshell, across from Visitor's Center. (908) 722-1200, ext. 351.
TRENTON WAR MEMORIAL ''The Canton Spirituals'' gospel concert. Saturday at 7 p.m. Tickets: $25 (advance); $30 (at the door). Lafayette and Willow Streets, Trenton. (609) 984-8400.

WESTMINSTER CHOIR COLLEGE OF RIDER UNIVERSITY Frances Slade leads ''Lift Every Voice and Sing II'' hymn sing. Monday at 7:30 p.m. ''Sing In: Bach's Magnificat.'' Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. The Netherlands' Limburg Choir. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. ''Workshop Concert: High School Piano Camp.'' Friday at 2 p.m. Free. Bristol Chapel, 101 Walnut Lane, Princeton. (609) 921-2663, ext. 308.
CENTER FOR LIFELONG LEARNING ''The Taming of the Shrew.'' Today at 4 p.m. Tickets: $5. Our Lady of the Magnificat Church, Miller Road, Kinnelon. (973) 492-5742.
CIRCLE PLAYERS ''Pippin.'' Through Aug. 5. Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m. and Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $13; $12 for Sunday matinees. 416 Victoria Avenue, Piscataway. (732) 968-7555.

DUNCAN SMITH THEATER The Holmdel Theater Company in ''Twelfth Night.'' Through July 23. Thursdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15. Crawfords Corner Road, Holmdel. (732) 946-0427.
FORUM THEATER COMPANY Comedian Robert Klein. Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $35. 314 Main Street, Metuchen. (732) 548-0582.

GARRIS CENTER THEATER ''Sylvia,'' A. R. Gurney's comedy performed by Tri-State Actors Theater. Thursday through Aug. 6. Thursday's preview performance at 8 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 3 p.m. Tickets: $15; $13 for students and older people and Sunday matinees; $11 for students and older people for Sunday matinees. 6 Broad Street, Branchville. (888) 840-7889.
HUDSON SHAKESPEARE COMPANY ''Othello.'' Tomorrow at 7 p.m. Free. Elysian Park, Hudson Street between 10th and 11th Streets, Hoboken. (201) 420-2207.

IRON MOUNTAIN STAGE COMPANY ''H.M.S. Pinafore'' or ''The Lass That Loved a Sailor.'' Thursday through Saturday at 8 p.m.; next Sunday at 2 p.m. Tickets: $12 on Thursday and Sunday; $15 on Friday and Saturday. Community Presbyterian Church, 145 Carletondale Road, Ringwood. (973) 962-9007.

J.C.C. MUSICAL THEATRE COMPANY ''Children of Eden.'' Today at 2 p.m. Tickets: $18; $15 for members, students and older people. Maurice Levin Theatre, 760 Northfield Avenue, West Orange. (973) 736-3200, ext. 253.

McCARTER THEATER Opera Festival of New Jersey. Through July 23. ''Six Characters in Search of an Author.'' Today at 2 p.m.; Saturday at 8 p.m. Frank Lewin's ''Burning Bright.'' Friday at 8 p.m.; next Sunday at 2 p.m. Tickets: $22 to $82. Center for the Performing Arts, 91 University Place, Princeton. (609) 258-2787.

MONMOUTH COUNTY LIBRARY Shakespeare in the Parking Lot presents ''Timon of Athens,'' with the New Jersey Shakespeare Festival's Next Stage Ensemble. Tuesday at 7:30 p.m. Barnes & Noble, Route 9, Freehold. (732) 431-7242.

MONTCLAIR STATE UNIVERSITY TheaterFest, the Professional Equity Theater-in-Residence in ''High Spirits,'' starring Kim Zimmer. Thursday through Aug. 6. Performances Tuesdays through Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 3 p.m.; Wednesday matinees at 2 p.m. Tickets: $35; $28 for older people. Valley Road and Normal Avenue, Upper Montclair. (973) 655-5112.

NEW JERSEY PERFORMING ARTS CENTER Summer Youth Performance Workshop in ''Brigadoon.'' Thursday at 12:30 p.m.; Friday and Saturday at 7 p.m.; next Sunday at 2 p.m. Victoria Theater. 1 Center Street, Newark. (888) 466-5722.

NEW JERSEY REPERTORY COMPANY ''An Unhappy Woman,'' staged reading of Michael T. Folie's black romantic comedy. Tomorrow at 2 p.m. and 7 p.m. Tickets: $7.50; reservations are recommended. Lumia Theater, 179 Broadway, Long Branch. (732) 229-3166.

NEW JERSEY SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL ''Twelfth Night.'' Tuesdays through Fridays at 8 p.m., Saturdays at 2 p.m and 8 p.m., Sundays at 2 p.m. and 7 p.m. Through July 30. Tickets: $21 to $38. F. M. Kirby Shakespeare Theater, 36 Madison Avenue, Madison. (973) 408-5600.

PAPER MILL PLAYHOUSE ''Pippin.'' Wednesday at 8 p.m.; Thursday at 2 p.m. and 8 p.m.; Friday at 8 p.m.; next Saturday at 2:30 p.m. and 8 p.m.; next Sunday at 2 p.m. and 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $36 to $60. Brookside Drive, Millburn. (973) 376-4343.
PARAMOUNT THEATER Verdi's ''Il Trovatore.'' Saturday at 8:15 p.m., with pre-opera talk at 7:30 p.m. Tickets: $20 to $45. Ocean and Fifth Avenues, Asbury Park. (732) 768-4122.
PARSIPPANY PLAYHOUSE Allegro Productions presents ''Jesus Christ Superstar.'' Friday and Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $25. 1130 Knoll Road, Parsippany. (973) 263-7020.
PLAYS IN THE PARK ''Evita.'' Wednesday through Saturday at 8:30 p.m. Tickets: $3. Stephen J. Capestro Theater, Roosevelt Park, off of Route 1 South, Edison. (732) 548-2884.

PREMIER THEATER COMPANY ''Damn Yankees.'' Thursday through Saturday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $20; $18 for older people; $15 for students; $12 for children 12 and under. Algonquin Arts Theater, 169 Main Street, Manasquan. (732) 223-7122.

PRINCETON REP SHAKESPEARE FESTIVAL ''A Midsummer Night's Dream.'' Friday, Saturday and next Sunday at 7 p.m. Free tickets are distributed at Fleet Financial Solutions Center, 16 Nassau Street, Monday through Friday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m., and Saturdays, 9 a.m. to noon. Performances are at Pettoranello Gardens, Mountain Avenue and Route 206, Community Park North, Princeton. (609) 688-0381 or (609) 921-3682.

TRI-STATE ACTORS THEATER ''The Velveteen Rabbit.'' Wednesday and Thursday at 10:30 a.m.; Friday and Saturday, 10:30 a.m. and 2 p.m. Wallkill Theater, Wallkill Valley Regional High School, Grumm Road, Hardyston. (888) 840-7889.

UNION COUNTY COLLEGE THEATER PROJECT ''Defying Gravity,'' by Jane Anderson. Thursday through Saturday at 8 p.m.; next Sunday at 3 p.m. Tickets: $12; $7 for students and older people. Roy W. Smith Theater, Cranford College Campus, 1033 Springfield Avenue. (908) 659-5189.

VAGABOND PLAYERS ''The Wizard of Oz.'' Through July 30. Saturdays and Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $10 for adults; $8 for children under 12. Shore Hills Country Club, Morse Place, Landing. (973) 398-3565.

WATERFRONT ENSEMBLE ''2nd Annual Hudson County All Ages Playwrights Festival.'' Wednesday and Thursday at 8 p.m. Tickets: $5. Stevens Institute, DeBaun Auditorium, 5th between Hudson and River Streets, Hoboken. (201) 963-2235.

ABC GALLERY ''Mostly Flowers: Oil Paintings and Paper Mosaics by Leila Bakashvili.'' Through Aug. 12. Hours: Mondays and Thursdays, 1 to 9 p.m.; Tuesdays and Wednesdays, 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Fridays, 1 p.m. to 5 p.m.; Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Lambertville Public Library, 6 Lilly Street, Lambertville. (609) 397-0275.

B. BEAMESDERFER GALLERY ''Three New England Artists: J. Ann Eldridge, David Cloutier and Abigail Rorer.'' Through Aug. 5. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 9:30 to 6 p.m.; or by appointment. 6 North Second Avenue, Highland Park. (732) 249-6971.

BRION GALLERIES ''Alien Beings of Uncertain Origin,'' one-man show of monotypes by Stephen McKenzie. Through Aug. 27. Hours: Wednesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Fridays and Saturdays, 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.; Sundays, 11 a.m. to 6 p.m. 1293 Route 179, Lambertville. (609) 397-7030.

CLEOPATRA STEPS OUT GALLERY ''Hang 10,'' fine crafts, home accessories, paintings and photography by 10 contemporary artists. Through Sept. 2. Hours: Thursdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Mondays through Wednesdays by appointment. 721 Cookman Avenue, Asbury Park. (732) 774-6306.

EXTENSION GALLERY Ayami Aoyama's ''Sculpture, Paintings and Drawings.'' Through Aug. 3. Hours: Mondays through Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; other times by appointment. 60 Ward Avenue Extension, Mercerville. (609) 890-7777.

GALLERY OF SOUTH ORANGE ''Suspended Animation,'' steel and bronze sculptures by Wendy Klemperer; ''Aspect of the Female Experience,'' concrete sculptures by Barbara Lubliner; ''Theater of the Moon,'' assemblages by Kimberly Maier. Through July 30. Hours: Wednesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. and 4 to 6 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Baird Center, 5 Mead Street, South Orange. (973) 378-7754.

HUNTERDON MUSEUM OF ART ''44th Annual National Juried Print Exhibition'' and ''Artists of Hunterdon County'' exhibition. Through July 30. Hours: Tuesdays through Sundays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m. 7 Lower Center Street, Clinton. (908) 735-8415.

JERSEY CITY MUSEUM ''The Prints of a Sculptor,'' by Melvin Edwards. Through Oct. 7. Hours: Tuesdays, Thursdays, and Fridays, 10:30 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Wednesdays, 10:30 a.m.to 8 p.m. 472 Jersey Avenue, Jersey City. (201) 547-4514.

LAUREL TRACEY GALLERY Summer Sculpture Series featuring works by Don Bonham, Don Harger, Michael Malpass and Jon Peters. Tuesday through Aug. 19. Opening reception: Saturday, 5:30 p.m. to 8:30 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10:30 a.m. to 5:30 p.m.; Sundays, 12:30 p.m. to 4:30 p.m. 10 White Street, Red Bank. (732) 224-0760.

MACCULLOCH HALL HISTORICAL MUSEUM ''Woven Into Words: Coverlets in America.'' Through Aug. 13. Admission: $3; $2 for older people and students. Hours: Wednesdays, Thursdays and Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. 45 Macculloch Avenue, Morristown. (973) 538-2404.

MAKEREADY PRESS GALLERY ''Hilltop Images'' photographic images by Mike Peters. Friday through Aug. 12. Cocktail reception: Saturday, 5 p.m. to 9 p.m. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 11 a.m. to 3 p.m.; Saturdays, 1 p.m. to 4 p.m. Gallery 214, 214 Glenridge Avenue, Montclair. (973) 744-8290.

MONTCLAIR ART MUSEUM ''Croquet: The Art of Play.' Through Oct. 15. Tuesdays through Sundays, noon to 7 p.m.; Sept. 9 through Oct. 15, course will be open Saturdays and Sundays, noon to 5 p.m. Admission: $7; $4 for children. ''Untamed Spirits: Animal Imagery in Native American Art.'' Through July 30. Will Barnet: A Timeless World. Through Aug. 20. Hours: Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Saturdays, 11 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays and Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Admission: $5; $4 for older people and students; free for members and children under 12. 3 South Mountain Avenue, Montclair. (973) 746-5555.

MORRIS COUNTY HISTORICAL SOCIETY ''1900,'' exhibit of photos, products and objects. Through Sept. Hours: Mondays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 4 p.m. Admission: $4; $2 for students. Acorn Hall, 68 Morris Avenue, Morristown. (973) 267-3465.

MORRIS MUSEUM ''Contemporary Paintings From the Morris Museum Collection.'' Through July 24. ''A Collector's Vision: Selections From the Collections of Edmund W. Pease and Nurak Israsena.'' Through Sept. 17. Hours: Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m.; Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Thursdays to 8 p.m. Admission: $5; $3 for older people and children under age 3. 6 Normandy Heights Road, Morristown. (973) 538-0454.

NEW JERSEY HISTORICAL SOCIETY ''History's Mysteries,'' interactive exhibition. Through July. ''Dining In, Dining Out,'' featuring photographs, video clips, rare silverware, period furniture and 18th-century cookbooks. Through summer 2001. ''Pride of Newark: Baseball's Bears and Eagles,'' about the history of baseball in Newark. Through Summer 2001. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. 52 Park Place, Newark. (973) 596-8500.

NEWARK MUSEUM ''Wetlands.'' Wednesday through Sept. 17. ''Shell Angelology.'' Through July 30. ''Year of the Dragon: The Calligraphy of Wang Fangyu.'' Through Nov. 12. ''Needless Necessity: Jewelry, Silver and Personal Meaning.'' Through December. Hours: Wednesdays through Sundays, noon to 5 p.m.; Thursdays (after hours) until 8:30 p.m. 49 Washington Street, Newark. (973) 596-6550.

PATERSON MUSEUM ''Up on Two Wheels: A Look Back at Motorcycling in North Jersey,'' show includes antique, classic, military, police, American, Japanese and European models. Through Sept. 24. ''Pair of Progenitors: The Art of Don Kommit and Joe Ruffilo.'' Through Sept. 2. Hours: Tuesdays through Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 12:30 to 4:30 p.m. 2 Market Street, Paterson. (973) 881-3839.

PRINCETON UNIVERSITY ART MUSEUM ''The Dawn of Maya Kings: An Early Maya Stela.'' Through July 30. Photographs by Barbara Bosworth. Through Sept. 3. ''Flora and Fauna in Chinese Painting.'' Through July 30. ''Yayoi Kusama: Early Drawings From the Collection of Richard Castellane.'' Through July 30. Hours: Tuesdays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Sundays, 1 to 5 p.m. Princeton campus. (609) 258-3788.

RUTGERS UNIVERSITY - CAMDEN ''Spirit of the Mask'' exhibit. Through July 29. Hours: Mondays through Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 4 p.m. Stedman Gallery, Third Street between Cooper Street and Benjamin Franklin Bridge, Camden. (856) 225-6350.

SETON HALL UNIVERSITY ''Public Pathways: The Olmsted Legacy,'' a photographic journal by Nancy J. Ori. Through Aug. 18. Hours: Mondays through Fridays, 10:30 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Walsh Library Gallery, 400 South Orange Avenue, South Orange. (973) 275-2033.

SPRINGFIELD PUBLIC LIBRARY ''American Paintings'' by Brian J. Dursee. Through Sept. 2. Hours: Mondays, Wednesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8:30 p.m.; Tuesdays and Fridays, 10 a.m. to 4:30 p.m. Donald B. Palmer Museum, 66 Mountain Avenue, Springfield. (973) 376-4930.

WHEATON VILLAGE ''American Glass: 1900-2000,'' featuring more than 100 industrial and decorative pieces. Through Oct. 22. Hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Admission: $7; $6 for older people; $3.50 for students. ''HER,'' multi-media exhibit. Through Aug. 13. No admission charge to The Gallery of American Craft. Exit 26, Route 55, Millville. (800) 998-4552, extension 2756.

JAMES YAROSH FINE ART AND DESIGN ''A Russian Fairy Tale: Fine Art of the Former Soviet Union.'' Through August. July's highlighted artist: Edward Yashin. Hours: Saturdays, noon to 4 p.m.; other times by appointment. 55 East Main Street, Holmdel. (732) 332-0056.

FORUM THEATER COMPANY ''Popeye the Sailor.'' Tuesday through July 29. Tuesdays and Thursdays at 10 a.m.; Wednesdays at 1 p.m.; Saturdays at 11 a.m. Tickets: $9. 314 Main Street, Metuchen. (732) 548-0582.

MORRIS MUSEUM ''When the Animals Talked.'' Tuesday at 11 a.m. and 1:30 p.m. ''On Safari.'' Thursday at 11 a.m. and 1:30 p.m. Tickets: $7.75; $6.50 for members. Children's Theater. 6 Normandy Heights Road, Morristown. (973) 538-8069.

NEWARK MUSEUM ''Where in the Universe Is Carmen Sandiego?'' at the Alice and Leonard Dreyfuss Planetarium. Through October. Hours: Wednesdays through Fridays at 2:30 p.m.; Saturdays and Sundays, 1 p.m. and 3 p.m. Tickets: $3; $2 for members; $1 for children and older people. 49 Washington Street, Newark. (973) 596-6355.

RITZ THEATER ''Big, the musical.'' Through Aug. 5. Fridays and Saturdays at 8 p.m.; Sundays at 2 p.m. Tickets: $16 for Fridays and Saturdays; $12.50 for Sundays. 915 White Horse Pike, Oaklyn. (856) 858-5230.

STOCKTON PERFORMING ARTS CENTER ''Alice in Wonderland,'' production by Bits'N Pieces Puppet Theater. Wednesday at 11 a.m., 2 p.m. and 6 p.m. Tickets: $7 and $5. Richard Stockton College, Jim Leeds Road, Pomona. (609) 652-9000.

STONY BROOK-MILLSTONE WATERSHED ''Parachute Play'' program. Tomorrow, Tuesday and Thursday, 10 a.m. to 11:30 a.m. For ages 3 to 5. Fee: $12. ''Tiny Tot Walks'' for children, aged 18 months to 36 months. Wednesday, 10 a.m. to 10:45 a.m. Fee: $5. Pre-registration is required. Buttinger Nature Center, 31 Titus Mill Road, Pennington. (609) 737-7592.

TRAILSIDE NATURE AND SCIENCE CENTER Planetarium Show. Today and next Sunday, 2 p.m. and 3:30 p.m. ''Spaceship Earth'' planetarium show. Thursday at 1:30 p.m. Pre-registration is required. Admission: $3; $2.55 for older people. 452 New Providence Road, Mountainside. (908) 789-3670.

WALT WHITMAN CULTURAL ARTS CENTER Fun Summer Fridays, through Aug. 25. The Bierkos. Friday, 10:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Free; donations accepted. Johnson Park at Second and Copper Streets, Camden. (856) 964-8300.
BARNES & NOBLE Catherine Coulter, author, will discuss and sign her book, ''The Maza.'' Tomorrow at 7 p.m. 3981 Highway 9, Freehold. (732) 409-2929.
BENNETT BOOK NOOK Catherine Coulter, author, will discuss and sign her book, ''Riptide.'' Tomorrow, 4 p.m. to 5 p.m. Wykoff Square Plaza, 303 Franklin Avenue, Wyckoff. (201) 891-8444.

BERNARDSVILLE PUBLIC LIBRARY Frank J. Korn, assistant professor of classical studies at Seton Hall University and author, will discuss and present a slide show about Rome's history and charms. Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Free. (908) 766-0118.

BOOKENDS BOOKSTORE Ridley Pearson, author, will discuss and sign his book ''Middle of Nowhere.'' Tomorrow at 7 p.m. Maury Allen, sports journalist, will discuss and sign his book, ''All Roads Lead to October: Boss Steinbrenner's 25 Year Reign in the Bronx.'' Wednesday at 7 p.m. 232 East Ridgewood Avenue, Ridgewood. (201) 445-0726.

ENGLEWOOD PUBLIC LIBRARY Frederick Dammont, an amateur photographer, will present a slide show and lecture, titled ''London and Thereabouts.'' Thursday at 7:30 p.m. Sheila's Book Club will discuss Wally Lamb's 1998 novel, ''I Know This Much Is True.'' Saturday at 2 p.m. Free. 31 Engle Street, Englewood. (201) 568-2215, ext. 244.

ALBA SUMMERFEST AT ALBA VINEYARD Saturday at 6 p.m. Includes music by Cairo, a reggae band; fireworks; food, wine and more. Tickets: $7.50; $4 for children, ages 6 to 12; free for children under 5. 269 Route 627, Village of Finesville. (908) 995-7800.

ENGLEWOOD PUBLIC LIBRARY ''Wednesday Night Comedy Film Festival.'' Through August. The Beatles' ''Help!'' Wednesday at 7:30 p.m. Seating is limited to 65 people. 31 Engle Street, Englewood. (201) 568-2215, ext. 244.

HISTORIC COLD SPRING VILLAGE Saturday Evening Concert Series. Through Sept. 2 C.C.C. Wind Symphony. Saturday at 6:30 p.m. Village Gazebo. Free. Route 9, three miles north of Cape May City. (609) 898-2300.

NEW JERSEY INTERNATIONAL FILM FESTIVAL SUMMER 2000 ''The Brig.'' Thursday at 7 p.m. Loree Hall, 24. Rutgers University, Nichol Avenue and George Street, Douglass College campus, New Brunswick. ''Sweep'' and ''Gendernauts.'' Friday at 7 p.m. ''Mental Hygiene: Classroom Guidance Films 1947-61 ''Dating, Delinquency and Diversity.'' Saturday at 7 p.m. Scott Hall, 123. Rutgers University, College Avenue and Hamilton Street, New Brunswick. Tickets: $5; $4 for members.(732) 932-8482.

OCEAN COUNTY HISTORICAL SOCIETY Civil War Day. Today, 8 a.m. to 5 p.m. Includes re-enactments, talks, clothing, music and more. Donation: $2; free for children 12 and under. Huddy Park, Toms River. (732) 341-1880.

RNS SHOW HOUSE AT THE SHORE The Ruth Newman Shapiro Cancer and Heart Fund will present its 10th annual exhibition of interior design rooms, decorative painting and outdoor living spaces. Today through Aug. 13. Hours: daily, 10 a.m. to 5 p.m.; Wednesdays and Thursdays, 10 a.m. to 8 p.m. Tickets: $20. Oceanside 1 and 2, the Boardwalk and Madison Avenue, the Northeast Inlet, Atlantic City. (609) 822-6338.
At the Casinos
All tickets are available through Ticketmaster, (800) 736-1420.

BALLY'S PARK PLACE Sinbad. Friday at 10 p.m.; Saturday at 9 p.m.; next Sunday at 8:30 p.m. Tickets: $35 and $40. ''Legends in Concert,'' impersonations of Stevie Wonder, Little Richard, Elvis Presley, Linda Ronstadt and Barbara Streisand.
